case_vignette: A 16-year-old male with past medical history of mitral valve prolapse presents for evaluation of loose skin. Patient's parents report a several year history of stretchy skin, poor wound healing with some scars healing with thin overlying skin, and easy bruising. There is a family history of similar symptoms amongst other family members. Physical examination reveals soft, significantly extensible skin diffusely, multiple linear scars with atrophic overlying pink patches, and white-yellow papules along the bilateral inner and outer calcaneus upon standing. The patient is able to touch the tip of his nose with his tongue.  The patient's skin is very fragile and tears easily. The patient's skin is also very sensitive to cold temperatures. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have stretchy skin, poor wound healing, easy bruising, and my skin is very sensitive to cold temperatures.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?

Yes, there is a family history of similar symptoms among other family members.
Final Diagnosis: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
